programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.(n)

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: In German-occupied Poland during the Second World War, businessman and Nazi Party member Oskar Schindler is deeply affected when he witnesses the clearing of the Krakow Ghetto. He decides to try to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: Six Minutes to Midnight
programme.desc: In the summer of 1939, influential families in Nazi Germany send their daughters to a finishing school in an English seaside town to learn the language and be ambassadors for Hitler. A teacher sees what is coming and tries to raise the alarm, but the authorities believe he is the problem. Thriller, starring Judi Dench, James D'Arcy, Jim Broadbent and Eddie Izzard.(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: A man diagnosed with HIV and given 30 days to live discovers that many treatments for his condition are not available in the US. With the aid of a transsexual Aids patient, he sets up a scheme to smuggle the drugs into the country and distribute them to those in need. Fact-based drama, starring Oscar winners Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, with Jennifer Garner and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: Allison is a young woman whose world falls apart when she survives an unimaginable tragedy. While in recovery for an opioid addiction and unresolved grief, she forms an unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law, Daniel, that gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together. Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: A single mother desperate for work pleads her way into a routine administrative job at a law firm. It is not long before she stumbles across mislaid documents about a case brought against a corporation for poisoning the residents of a small town by contaminating their water supply. Realising something is amiss, she begins her own investigation. Fact-based drama, with Julia Roberts in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Albert Finney and Aaron Eckhart.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: When a couple flee Europe in 1947, their new lives in the US are changed by a strange client. Director Brady Corbet's drama, starring Adrien Brody, Felicity Jones, Guy Pearce and Joe Alwyn.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: A look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
programme.desc: A grizzled drifter rescues a nun from a gang of rapists and gets roped into escorting her across the Mexican desert. He gradually realises there is more to his new companion than meets the eye - and she may be hiding a surprising secret. Don Siegel's Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Shirley MacLaine, Manolo Fabregas, Alberto Morin and John Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: A 1960s singing trio are chosen to perform backing vocals for a popular performer - an event that launches the band on a successful career of their own. However, when the most attractive of the girls is picked as the face of the group, edging out the other two, personal rivalries begin to jeopardise their friendship. Musical drama, inspired by the rise to fame of Diana Ross and the Supremes, and starring Jamie Foxx, Beyonce Knowles, Eddie Murphy and an Oscar-winning Jennifer Hudson.(n)

programme.title: The Post
programme.desc: In 1971, an American military analyst uncovers the depths of the US government's deceptions about the futility of the Vietnam War, and takes action by copying top-secret documents that would become the Pentagon Papers. Washington Post owner Kay Graham and her editor Ben Bradlee discover The New York Times is preparing an explosive expose on those papers and, determined to compete, set out to publish them first. Steven Spielberg's fact-based drama, starring Meryl Streep, Tom Hanks, Sarah Paulson and Bob Odenkirk.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: A single mother desperate for work pleads her way into a routine administrative job at a law firm. It is not long before she stumbles across mislaid documents about a case brought against a corporation for poisoning the residents of a small town by contaminating their water supply. Realising something is amiss, she begins her own investigation. Fact-based drama, with Julia Roberts in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Albert Finney and Aaron Eckhart.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: A soldier falls in love with a student he meets while on two weeks' leave, and he promises to seek her out after completing his tour of duty. However, in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks, he decides to re-enlist in the army, putting their relationship to the test. Romantic drama, with Channing Tatum and Amanda Seyfried.(n)

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: A single man gets the chance to turn his unhappy life around when his father reveals that they both have the ability to travel through time and change their personal history. He uses his newfound talent to try to improve his love life and win the heart of an American woman he has fallen for. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: An idealistic sports agent produces a mission statement at work promising to treat clients fairly. Unfortunately, it costs him his job. Forced to set up an agency on his own, the only people prepared to stand by him are a lovelorn staff accountant and a footballer. Cameron Crowe's romantic comedy drama, with Tom Cruise, Renee Zellweger, Kelly Preston, Jonathan Lipnicki, and Cuba Gooding Jr, who won an Oscar for his performance.(n)

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: An American naval reserve pilot is called up for service in the Korean War, and must leave his family and civilian job as a lawyer. In command of a corps of naval pilots, he heads a bombing campaign on strategic Communist positions, but later comes to question the morality of the conflict. Adventure, starring William Holden, Grace Kelly, Fredric March and Mickey Rooney.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: A look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.

programme.title: The Friend
programme.desc: When a solitary writer adopts and bonds with a Great Dane that belonged to a late friend, she begins to come to terms with her past and her own creative inner life. Drama based on the novel by Sigrid Nunez, starring Naomi Watts and Bill Murray.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: A single man gets the chance to turn his unhappy life around when his father reveals that they both have the ability to travel through time and change their personal history. He uses his newfound talent to try to improve his love life and win the heart of an American woman he has fallen for. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.

programme.title: Joker: Folie a Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck meets the love of his life, Harleen 'Lee' Quinzel, while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Musical thriller, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Lady Gaga and Brendan Gleeson.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: A look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: A radio DJ contemplates suicide after a listener embarks on a murderous rampage in response to one of his broadcasts. He is saved by a now-homeless former professor of medieval history, who encourages him to retrieve what he claims is the Holy Grail. When the DJ later learns that he is responsible for his saviour's misfortunes, he feels compelled to make amends. Terry Gilliam's comedy drama, with Robin Williams, Jeff Bridges, Amanda Plummer and Mercedes Ruehl.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: A man diagnosed with HIV and given 30 days to live discovers that many treatments for his condition are not available in the US. With the aid of a transsexual Aids patient, he sets up a scheme to smuggle the drugs into the country and distribute them to those in need. Fact-based drama, starring Oscar winners Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, with Jennifer Garner and Steve Zahn.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Joker: Folie a Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck meets the love of his life, Harleen 'Lee' Quinzel, while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Musical thriller, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Lady Gaga and Brendan Gleeson.

programme.title: Empire of the Sun
programme.desc: An English boy living in Shanghai is separated from his parents during the Japanese invasion and forced to live on the streets. The youngster is befriended by an American sailor, who helps the boy adapt to life without his family, before the pair are eventually captured and subjected to the terrors of internment. Steven Spielberg's Second World War drama based on JG Ballard's semi-autobiographical novel, starring Christian Bale, John Malkovich and Nigel Havers.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: A retired army colonel has raised his three sons alone on their remote Montana ranch. But the all-male household is thrown into turmoil when the youngest son brings home his beautiful fiancee, causing jealousy and tensions that culminate in tragedy. Edward Zwick's period drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Brad Pitt, Aidan Quinn, Julia Ormond and Henry Thomas.

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: A man diagnosed with HIV and given 30 days to live discovers that many treatments for his condition are not available in the US. With the aid of a transsexual Aids patient, he sets up a scheme to smuggle the drugs into the country and distribute them to those in need. Fact-based drama, starring Oscar winners Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, with Jennifer Garner and Steve Zahn.

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.

programme.title: Empire of the Sun
programme.desc: An English boy living in Shanghai is separated from his parents during the Japanese invasion and forced to live on the streets. The youngster is befriended by an American sailor, who helps the boy adapt to life without his family, before the pair are eventually captured and subjected to the terrors of internment. Steven Spielberg's Second World War drama based on JG Ballard's semi-autobiographical novel, starring Christian Bale, John Malkovich and Nigel Havers.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: A retired army colonel has raised his three sons alone on their remote Montana ranch. But the all-male household is thrown into turmoil when the youngest son brings home his beautiful fiancee, causing jealousy and tensions that culminate in tragedy. Edward Zwick's period drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Brad Pitt, Aidan Quinn, Julia Ormond and Henry Thomas.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters are raised by their strong-willed mother while their father is away fighting in the American Civil War. Although one yearns to become a writer and another dreams of being married, the girls remain firmly united as the family steers a course through hard times and tragic events. Period drama, based on Louisa May Alcott's novel, with Winona Ryder, Susan Sarandon, Claire Danes, Samantha Mathis and Kirsten Dunst.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Rachel Marron, a famous singer and actress is subjected to death threats by an obsessive fan and persuaded to hire a former secret service agent as her bodyguard. However, neither she or her new minder realise the effect they are about to have on each other's lives. Romantic thriller directed by Mick Jackson, starring Kevin Costner, Whitney Houston, Gary Kemp and Bill Cobbs.

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A naive young literature student's life is thrown into turmoil by an affair with a mysterious billionaire. Initially she is intrigued by his aloof and distant manner, but soon realises he is harbouring dark secrets and desires. Erotic drama based on EL James' bestseller, starring Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: The bookish Anastasia Steele and damaged billionaire playboy Christian Grey continue their sadomasochistic relationship, while their safety is threatened by strangers from his past. While Christian wrestles with his inner demons, Anastasia must confront the anger and envy of the women who came before her. Erotic drama sequel to Fifty Shades of Grey, starring Dakota Johnson, Jamie Dornan, Eric Johnson, Bella Heathcote and Rita Ora.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Freed
programme.desc: As tycoon Christian Grey and his new wife, Anastasia revel in a life of luxury, their happiness is endangered by her former boss. Conclusion of the romantic thriller trilogy based on EL James' novel, starring Dakota Johnson, Jamie Dornan and Eric Johnson.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters are raised by their strong-willed mother while their father is away fighting in the American Civil War. Although one yearns to become a writer and another dreams of being married, the girls remain firmly united as the family steers a course through hard times and tragic events. Period drama, based on Louisa May Alcott's novel, with Winona Ryder, Susan Sarandon, Claire Danes, Samantha Mathis and Kirsten Dunst.(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.(n)

programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Rachel Marron, a famous singer and actress is subjected to death threats by an obsessive fan and persuaded to hire a former secret service agent as her bodyguard. However, neither she or her new minder realise the effect they are about to have on each other's lives. Romantic thriller directed by Mick Jackson, starring Kevin Costner, Whitney Houston, Gary Kemp and Bill Cobbs.(n)

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: Ice skater Tonya Harding rises through the ranks at the US figure skating championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into question by a shocking incident after her ex-husband steps in. Director Craig Gillespie's comedy biopic, starring Margot Robbie, Sebastian Stan, and Allison Janney, who won a Bafta and an Oscar for her performance.(n)

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas.(n)

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: Molly's Game
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the night by FBI agents wielding automatic weapons. Her players included Hollywood royalty, sports stars, business titans and finally - unbeknownst to her - the Russian Mob. Directed by The West Wing creator Aaron Sorkin, and starring Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba and Kevin Costner.(n)

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Tinsel Town
programme.desc: Washed-up Hollywood action hero Bradley Mack takes a role in a small English village's quirky Christmas pantomime, where he finds unexpected inspiration through the show's straight-talking dance instructor. Festive family comedy, starring Kiefer Sutherland, Rebel Wilson, Alice Eve and Danny Dyer.(n)

programme.title: A Minecraft Movie
programme.desc: Four misfits are yanked through a strange portal into a cubic realm powered by imagination. To return home, they must learn its rules and journey alongside an unlikely master crafter. Director Jared Hess's blockbusting fantasy adventure based on the hit videogame, starring Jack Black, Jason Momoa, Emma Myers and Jennifer Coolidge.(n)

programme.title: The Phoenician Scheme
programme.desc: Wealthy businessman Zsa-Zsa Korda appoints his only daughter, a nun, as sole heir to his estate. As Korda embarks on a new enterprise, they become the target of scheming tycoons, foreign terrorists and determined assassins. Writer/director Wes Anderson's comedy, starring Benicio del Toro, Mia Threapleton and Michael Cera.(n)

programme.title: Sinners
programme.desc: Hoping to escape their troubled pasts, twin brothers return to their hometown to start over, only to find an even darker force waiting to welcome them back. Writer/director Ryan Coogler's blockbusting horror thriller, starring Michael B Jordan, Miles Caton and Saul Williams.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt is in exile with both halves of the 3D cruciform key that can unlock the source code of rogue AI creation, the Entity. Hunt returns to London to reunite with Luther Stickell, Benji Dunn and former thief Grace. The Entity's human henchman, Gabriel, is still on the loose, so Hunt bolsters his ranks with vengeful French assassin Paris and US intelligence agent Theo Degas. Action thriller, starring Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg and Esai Morales.(n)

programme.title: A Minecraft Movie
programme.desc: Four misfits are yanked through a strange portal into a cubic realm powered by imagination. To return home, they must learn its rules and journey alongside an unlikely master crafter. Director Jared Hess's blockbusting fantasy adventure based on the hit videogame, starring Jack Black, Jason Momoa, Emma Myers and Jennifer Coolidge.(n)

programme.title: Karate Kid: Legends
programme.desc: Kung fu prodigy Li Fong moves to New York City with his mother and befriends his classmate, Mia. But Connor Day, a local karate champion, provokes Li and publicly humiliates him. Li seeks guidance from his mentor, the kung fu master Mr Han, who reaches out to Daniel LaRusso, convincing the original Karate Kid to teach Li the principles of Miyagi Karate. Drama sequel, starring Jackie Chan, Ben Wang and Ralph Macchio.(n)

programme.title: Sinners

programme.desc: Two rivals fight for control of a major crime family. Director Barry Levinson's drama based on true events, starring Robert De Niro, Cosmo Jarvis and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Friendship
programme.desc: Office worker Craig Waterman meets Austin Carmichael, a local TV weatherman who has not made any friends yet and possesses the natural easy-going charm that Craig so obviously lacks. The men become mainstays in each other's lives, but Craig is ill-equipped for polite social interactions and his behaviour becomes increasingly unhinged. Comedy, starring Paul Rudd, Kate Mara and Tim Robinson.(n)

Writer/director Wes Anderson's comedy, starring Benicio del Toro, Mia Threapleton and Michael Cera.

programme.title: Hallow Road
programme.desc: Two parents are thrust into a desperate race against time after a late-night call from their daughter reveals she caused a devastating car accident. Director Babak Anvari's psychological thriller, starring Rosamund Pike and Matthew Rhys.

programme.title: A Make or Break Holiday
programme.desc: A couple on the brink of separation agrees to pretend they are still together while hosting Christmas for their families. But as they work side by side to pull off the perfect holiday, they rediscover the spark they thought was gone. Romantic drama, starring Jennifer-Juniper Angeli.

programme.title: An Alpine Holiday
programme.desc: Estranged sisters Faith and Kelly reunite for Christmas in the French Alps, reminiscing their grandfather's first trip. They cherish sisterhood and romance with their guide, Frederic. Romantic comedy drama, starring Ashley Williams and Laci J Mailey.

programme.title: A Minecraft Movie
programme.desc: Four misfits are yanked through a strange portal into a cubic realm powered by imagination. To return home, they must learn its rules and journey alongside an unlikely master crafter. Director Jared Hess's blockbusting fantasy adventure based on the hit videogame, starring Jack Black, Jason Momoa, Emma Myers and Jennifer Coolidge.

programme.title: Friendship
programme.desc: Office worker Craig Waterman meets Austin Carmichael, a local TV weatherman who has not made any friends yet and possesses the natural easy-going charm that Craig so obviously lacks. The men become mainstays in each other's lives, but Craig is ill-equipped for polite social interactions and his behaviour becomes increasingly unhinged. Comedy, starring Paul Rudd, Kate Mara and Tim Robinson.

programme.title: Sinners
programme.desc: Hoping to escape their troubled pasts, twin brothers return to their hometown to start over, only to find an even darker force waiting to welcome them back. Writer/director Ryan Coogler's blockbusting horror thriller, starring Michael B Jordan, Miles Caton and Saul Williams.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt is in exile with both halves of the 3D cruciform key that can unlock the source code of rogue AI creation, the Entity. Hunt returns to London to reunite with Luther Stickell, Benji Dunn and former thief Grace. The Entity's human henchman, Gabriel, is still on the loose, so Hunt bolsters his ranks with vengeful French assassin Paris and US intelligence agent Theo Degas. Action thriller, starring Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg and Esai Morales.

programme.title: A Minecraft Movie
programme.desc: Four misfits are yanked through a strange portal into a cubic realm powered by imagination. To return home, they must learn its rules and journey alongside an unlikely master crafter. Director Jared Hess's blockbusting fantasy adventure based on the hit videogame, starring Jack Black, Jason Momoa, Emma Myers and Jennifer Coolidge.

Writer/director Wes Anderson's comedy, starring Benicio del Toro, Mia Threapleton and Michael Cera.

programme.title: Hallow Road
programme.desc: Two parents are thrust into a desperate race against time after a late-night call from their daughter reveals she caused a devastating car accident. Director Babak Anvari's psychological thriller, starring Rosamund Pike and Matthew Rhys.

programme.title: She's Making a List
programme.desc: A Christmas inspector whose job it is to decide whether children have been naughty or nice fall for the widowed father of the girl she's supposed to evaluate. Before she knows it, her job - and her heart - are on the line. Romantic comedy, starring Lacey Chabert and Alessandro Miro.

programme.title: 28 Years Later
programme.desc: Decades since the rage virus took hold, the survivors live on a small island. When one of the group leaves on a mission into the mainland, he discovers secrets, wonders, and horrors that have mutated not only the infected but other survivors. Danny Boyle's horror thriller sequel, starring Jodie Comer, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Ralph Fiennes and Rocco Haynes.

programme.title: Karate Kid: Legends
programme.desc: Kung fu prodigy Li Fong moves to New York City with his mother and befriends his classmate, Mia. But Connor Day, a local karate champion, provokes Li and publicly humiliates him. Li seeks guidance from his mentor, the kung fu master Mr Han, who reaches out to Daniel LaRusso, convincing the original Karate Kid to teach Li the principles of Miyagi Karate. Drama sequel, starring Jackie Chan, Ben Wang and Ralph Macchio.

A League of Their Own. Dan Burn, Patrice Evra, Maisie Adam
The Best Christmas Pageant Ever
programme.desc: Nobody is ready for the mayhem and surprises that ensue when six of the worst youngsters disrupt the town's yearly Christmas performance.

programme.title: Planes, Trains & Automobiles
programme.desc: Anxious to get home for the holidays, exec Steve Martin is forced to hit the road with sales oaf John Candy. Classic comic caper. Strong language/flashing images.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: Wildly successful, yet heartless TV boss Bill Murray is taught the error of his ways by three Yuletide ghosts on Christmas eve. Comedic festive classic.

programme.title: Prancer: A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: A reindeer and a young girl work together to save her grandfather's beloved store in the tiny town of Brightridge. Magical Sky Original Christmas film.

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa's clumsy son Arthur must save the day when his dad's present delivery system misses someone out. Festive animation with the voices of James McAvoy and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: The Polar Express
programme.desc: Fabulous animated fairy tale about a boy who doesn't believe in Santa, until a train conductor invites him on a journey to the North Pole.

programme.title: Genie
programme.desc: Richard Curtis' Sky Original festive comedy about a genie, a man and landing a chance to fix the mess you've made of life. Melissa McCarthy and Paapa Essiedu star.

programme.title: Tinsel Town
programme.desc: Washed-up Hollywood star Kiefer Sutherland joins an English village's Christmas pantomime, with the help of dance instructor Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: 12 Days Of Christmas Eve
programme.desc: When businessman Kelsey Grammer gets into a car accident on Christmas Eve, Santa gives him 12 chances to re-do the day and repair the relationships in his life.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: Wildly successful, yet heartless TV boss Bill Murray is taught the error of his ways by three Yuletide ghosts on Christmas eve. Comedic festive classic.

programme.title: She's Making A List
programme.desc: A Naughty-or-Nice inspector evaluating a girl's Christmas status falls for her widowed father, making her question the strict rules of her consulting firm.

programme.title: Sleepless In Seattle
programme.desc: Lonely widower Tom Hanks becomes a reluctant radio star when his young son calls in to a talk show requesting him a new wife. Classic Nora Ephron romcom with Meg Ryan.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Richard Curtis's romantic comedy following the intertwining lives of a group of loved-up Londoners. Hugh Grant, Colin Firth and Liam Neeson star.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: In need of a romantic reboot, Cameron Diaz and Kate Winslet swap countries to meet the men of their dreams, Jude Law and Jack Black. Seasonal romcom. Strong language/sex.

programme.title: Nativity 2: Danger In The Manger!
programme.desc: A manic road trip ensues when new teacher David Tennant reluctantly takes his class to enter a Song for Christmas competition. Fun festive sequel with Marc Wootton.

programme.title: Nativity 3: Dude Where's My Donkey
programme.desc: The pupils of St Bernadette's must save the day when teacher Martin Clunes gets kicked by a nativity donkey and loses his memory. Family sequel.

programme.title: All I Want For Christmas
programme.desc: Touching tale about two kids who try to reunite their divorced parents for Christmas, helped by their grandmother (Lauren Bacall) and Santa (Leslie Nielsen).

programme.title: Tidings For The Season
programme.desc: A newscaster's life changes when he meets a superfan and the boy's hardworking single mum. Romance blooms, but an opportunity forces him to choose between ambition and love.

programme.desc: A mysterious cloaked figure on a bloodthirsty rampage interrupts the Christmas cheer at Hawthorne College. Slasher.

programme.title: Planes, Trains & Automobiles
programme.desc: Anxious to get home for the holidays, exec Steve Martin is forced to hit the road with sales oaf John Candy. Classic comic caper. Strong language/flashing images.

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa's clumsy son Arthur must save the day when his dad's present delivery system misses someone out. Festive animation with the voices of James McAvoy and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: The Polar Express
programme.desc: Fabulous animated fairy tale about a boy who doesn't believe in Santa, until a train conductor invites him on a journey to the North Pole.

programme.title: A Boy Called Christmas
programme.desc: Welcome to the tale of Father Christmas, who was once just a young boy named Nikolas. A magical Christmas adventure with Dame Maggie Smith.

programme.title: The Night Before Christmas In...
programme.desc: The Queen of Hearts has outlawed Christmas! Can St Nick, Alice, the Mad Hatter and March Hare save the day? Animation with Emilia Clarke, Gerard Butler and Simone Ashley.

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: The grumpy old Grinch hatches a dastardly scheme to ruin Christmas in Whoville. Animated Dr Seuss adaptation with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch and Pharrell Williams.

programme.title: The Polar Express
programme.desc: Fabulous animated fairy tale about a boy who doesn't believe in Santa, until a train conductor invites him on a journey to the North Pole.

programme.title: Genie

programme.title: Tinsel Town
programme.desc: Washed-up Hollywood star Kiefer Sutherland joins an English village's Christmas pantomime, with the help of dance instructor Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: Tidings For The Season
programme.desc: A newscaster's life changes when he meets a superfan and the boy's hardworking single mum. Romance blooms, but an opportunity forces him to choose between ambition and love.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: Wildly successful, yet heartless TV boss Bill Murray is taught the error of his ways by three Yuletide ghosts on Christmas eve. Comedic festive classic.

programme.title: Gremlins

programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. programme.desc: Young Angelo dreams of becoming an explorer and a zoologist. When he goes to visit his granny, his parents leave him behind at a rest stop, and he decides to cut through the forest in search of them. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Kristen McGuire.

programme.desc: Wide-eyed kitten Garfield is abandoned by his father Vic and left in an alleyway. Years later, when the ginger moggie has been 'adopted' by long-suffering human Jon Arbuckle, a case of catnapping reunites the pet with his crooked father. programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young couple flee the city during a zombie outbreak, only to be involved in a car crash. When the man awakes, his girlfriend is missing, so he bands together with a rugged survivalist to find his partner - but he only has selected memories of what he has been through. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray.

programme.desc: A science teacher's life changes when he reconnects with his first love and suspects a new student is his daughter, all while facing an alien threat in their town. Sci-fi comedy drama, starring Brandon Routh, Mena Suvari and Malina Pauli Weissman.

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills.

programme.desc: Wealthy businessman Zsa-Zsa Korda appoints his only daughter, a nun, as sole heir to his estate. Writer/director Wes Anderson's comedy, starring Benicio del Toro, Mia Threapleton and Michael Cera.

programme.title: Fay Grim

programme.desc: A journalist is invited to the remote compound of a legendary pop star who mysteriously disappeared 30 years ago. Surrounded by the star's cult of sycophants, she gets caught in the middle of his twisted plan.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: In a future where time is money and the wealthy can live forever, Will Salas (Justin Timberlake) is a poor man who rarely has more than a day's worth of life on his time clock. When he saves Henry Hamilton (Matt Bomer) from time thieves, Will receives the gift of a century. However, such a large transaction attracts the attention of the authorities, and when Will is falsely accused of murder, he m

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: Armed with nothing but a hatful of dreams, young chocolatier Willy Wonka manages to change the world, one delectable bite at a time.

programme.title: Music Box: Happy and You Know It
Hidden Figures
programme.desc: Three brilliant African American women at NASA, Katherine Johnson, Dorothy Vaughan and Mary Jackson, serve as the brains behind one of the greatest operations in history, the launch of astronaut John Glenn into orbit, a stunning achievement that restored the nation's confidence, turned around the Space Race and galvanized the world.

programme.title: Mickey 17
programme.desc: A disposable employee is sent on a human expedition to colonize the ice world Niflheim. After one iteration dies, a new body is regenerated with most of his memories intact.

programme.title: Warfare
programme.desc: The harrowing true story of a U.S. Navy SEAL platoon surveillance mission gone dangerously wrong.

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: In an alternate 1980s, the United States stands alone as communism grows stronger. When Soviet soldiers invade a small Colorado town, brothers Jed (Patrick Swayze) and Matt Eckert (Charlie Sheen) escape with friends to the forest. With their father, Tom (Harry Dean Stanton), a prisoner of the invading army, the children decide to fight against the Soviets. As the country comes under increasing att

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: When North Korean troops invade U.S. soil and take over the city of Spokane, Wash., a recently returned Iraq War veteran and a group of teens flee to the woods and form a band of freedom fighters. Dubbing themselves the Wolverines, the youths launch guerrilla attacks against the invaders, but how long they can sustain the fight in the face of the enemy's superior numbers and firepower remains in q

programme.title: Final Destination Bloodlines
programme.desc: Plagued by a violent and recurring nightmare, a college student heads home to track down the one person who might be able to break the cycle of death and save her family from the grisly demise that inevitably awaits them all.

programme.title: The Substance
programme.desc: Fading actress Elisabeth Sparkle becomes distressed when her chauvinistic boss fires her from her aerobics show. She soon injects herself with a mysterious serum that promises a younger, better version of herself, but things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Bullied as a teen for being overweight, Bob Stone (Dwayne Johnson) shows up to his high school reunion looking fit and muscular. Stone is now a lethal CIA agent who needs Calvin's number skills to help him save the compromised U.S. spy satellite system. Together, the former c

programme.desc: Caesar (Andy Serkis) and his apes are forced into a deadly conflict with an army of humans led by a ruthless colonel (Woody Harrelson). As the journey finally brings them face to face, Caesar and the colonel are pitted against each other in an epic battle that wi

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Scientists, soldiers and adventurers unite to explore a mythical, uncharted island in the Pacific Ocean. Cut off from everything they know, they venture into the domain of the mighty Kong, igniting the ultimate battle between man and nature. As their mission of discovery soon becomes one of survival, they must fight to escape from a primal world where humanity does not belong.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: Flight Risk
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal boards a small plane to transfer a government witness to New York. As they cross the Alaskan wilderness, tensions start to rise as not everyone on the flight is who they appear to be.

programme.title: Talk to Me
programme.desc: When a group of friends discover how to conjure spirits with an embalmed hand, they become hooked on the new thrill and high-stakes party game -- until one of them goes too far and unleashes terrifying supernatural forces.

programme.title: Music Box: Happy and You Know It
Bad Santa
programme.desc: In this dark comedy, the crotchety Willie T. Stokes (Billy Bob Thornton) and his partner (Tony Cox) reunite once a year for a holiday con. Posing as a mall Santa and his elf, they rip off shopping outlets on Christmas Eve. This year, however, Willie is falling apart. He's depressed and alcoholic, and his erratic behavior draws the suspicion of mall security (Bernie Mac). But when befriending a sma

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Hoping to expose corruption, radical activists take 300 hostages at an energy company's annual gala in a high-rise building. Their cause soon gets hijacked by an extremist within their ranks who's ready to kill everyone. It's now up to a former soldier who works as a window cleaner to save the hostages trapped inside, including her younger brother.

programme.title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
programme.desc: In a prison cell somewhere in Latin America, two very different men warily confront each other. Molina (William Hurt) is first seen wrapping his head in a towel, in the shape of a turban, while Valentin (Raul Julia), bearded and classically macho in appearance, watches with a mixture of fascination and revulsion. During the time spent together, the two men come to understand and respect each other

programme.title: Dances With Wolves
programme.desc: A Civil War soldier develops a relationship with a band of Lakota Indians. Attracted by the simplicity of their lifestyle, he chooses to leave his former life behind to be with them. Having observed him, they give the name Dances With Wolves. Soon he is a welcomed member of the tribe and falls in love with a white woman who has been raised in the tribe. programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: Just before the destruction of the planet Krypton, scientist Jor-El (Marlon Brando) sends his infant son Kal-El on a spaceship to Earth. Raised by kindly farmers Jonathan (Glenn Ford) and Martha Kent (Phyllis Thaxter), young Clark (Christopher Reeve) discovers the source of his superhuman powers and moves to Metropolis to fight evil. As Superman, he battles the villainous Lex Luthor (Gene Hackman)

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: Superman (Christopher Reeve) foils the plot of terrorists by hurtling their nuclear device into outer space, but the bomb's shock waves free the Kryptonian villain General Zod (Terence Stamp) and his henchmen Ursa (Sarah Douglas) and Non (Jack O'Halloran) from their imprisonment. Traveling to Earth, they threaten the planet with destruction at the same time that Superman decides to renounce his su

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wake Forest and NC State meet at the Lenovo Center for their ACC opener. Both teams enter at 9-4, with Juke Harris leading the Demon Deacons while Darrion Williams paces the Wolfpack. NC State seeks to protect home court in this conference showdown.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Tigers visit the Orange at JMA Wireless Dome for a New Year's Eve ACC game. Naithan George leads Syracuse after a win over Stonehill. Tigers forward RJ Godfrey looks to extend a win streak while averaging 11.3 points per game for the visitors.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Memphis Tigers take on the North Texas Mean Green at the FedExForum. The Mean Green enter following a 109-56 victory over Science and Arts Oklahoma. Memphis comes off an 88-67 win against Alabama State led by 23 points from Dug McDaniel.
